item.title: 562 gate of wars objects, npcs, npc definition and item definitions
item.dc:creator: @stevenlin598 stevenlin598
item.description:
@stevenlin598 wrote:

562 gate of wars

Objects::

case 16123://GATE OF WAR if(player.getLocation().getX() == 1858 && player.getLocation().getY() == 5239) { player.tele(1858, 5237, 0); } else if(player.getLocation().getX() == 1858 && player.getLocation().getY() == 5236) { player.tele(1858, 5235, 0); } else if(player.getLocation().getX() == 1858 && player.getLocation().getY() == 5237) { player.tele(1858, 5239, 0); } else if(player.getLocation().getX() == 1864 && player.getLocation().getY() == 5228) { player.tele(1866, 5228, 0); } break; case 16124://GATE OF WAR 2 if(player.getLocation().getX() == 1859 && player.getLocation().getY() == 5239) { player.tele(1859, 5237, 0); } else if(player.getLocation().getX() == 1859 && player.getLocation().getY() == 5236) { player.tele(1859, 5235, 0); } else if(player.getLocation().getX() == 1859 && player.getLocation().getY() == 5237) { player.tele(1859, 5239, 0); } else if(player.getLocation().getX() == 1864 && player.getLocation().getY() == 5227) { player.tele(1866, 5227, 0); } else if(player.getLocation().getX() == 1911 && player.getLocation().getY() == 5207) { player.tele(1911, 5206, 0); } else if(player.getLocation().getX() == 1911 && player.getLocation().getY() == 5220) { player.tele(1911, 5209, 0); } break; case 16149://GATE OF WAR rope if(player.getLocation().getX() == 1902 && player.getLocation().getY() == 5221) { player.tele(2042, 5245, 0); } else if(player.getLocation().getX() == 1903 && player.getLocation().getY() == 5221) { player.tele(2042, 5245, 0); } break;Put it in the object1packethandler.java

This is for the Npc’s:

<npc><id>100</id><location><x>1858</x><y>5236</y><z>0</z></location></npc>//gate of war place <npc><id>100</id><location><x>1860</x><y>5215</y><z>0</z></location></npc> <npc><id>4405</id><location><x>1871</x><y>5227</y><z>0</z></location></npc>This if for the spawns:

<spawn> <location> <x>1907</x> <y>5221</y> <z>0</z> </location> <item> <id>10346</id> <amount>3</amount> </item> </spawn> <spawn> <location> <x>1907</x> <y>5221</y> <z>0</z> </location> <item> <id>10345</id> <amount>3</amount> </item> </spawn>Lastly, this is the Npc definition for them. They still attack weird because I didn’t change the attack animation:

<npcDefinition> <id>4404</id> <name>Minotaur</name> <examine>A minataur</examine> <respawn>5</respawn> <combat>17</combat> <hitpoints>26</hitpoints> <maxHit>5</maxHit> <attackSpeed>10</attackSpeed> <attackAnim>2890</attackAnim> <defenceAnim>9455</defenceAnim> <deathAnim>1</deathAnim>//unknown </npcDefinition> <npcDefinition> <id>4405</id> <name>Minotaur</name> <examine>A minataur</examine> <respawn>5</respawn> <combat>23</combat> <hitpoints>40</hitpoints> <maxHit>10</maxHit> <attackSpeed>10</attackSpeed> <attackAnim>2890</attackAnim> <defenceAnim>9455</defenceAnim> <deathAnim>1</deathAnim>//unknown </npcDefinition> <npcDefinition> <id>4406</id> <name>Minotaur</name> <examine>A minataur</examine> <respawn>5</respawn> <combat>27</combat> <hitpoints>48</hitpoints> <maxHit>13</maxHit> <attackSpeed>12</attackSpeed> <attackAnim>2890</attackAnim> <defenceAnim>9455</defenceAnim> <deathAnim>1</deathAnim>//unknown </npcDefinition>
